section.name: Configuration file
section.p: The tools default behavior is to load a configuration file from the classpath org/esigate/driver.properties

tr.td:
Base URL of the remote application. Eg: remoteUrlBase=http://localhost:8080/provider/
When clustering (remote application runs on several servers), use a coma-separated list.
Charset used for encoding parameters in URI
List of parsable content types.. Use this syntax to set content types : parsableContentTypes=text/html,application/xhtml+xml,text/plain
Maximum number of HTTP connections simultaneously opened with 1 server.
Defines the timeout while trying to establish a connection with the server.
Defines the timeout waiting for data once the connection to the server has been opened.
Proxy host name or IP. The tool can work through an HTTP proxy server.
Username used by the driver for proxy authentication. Leave blank if no authentication is required by the proxy.
Instructs send the request to the target server with the same Host header value as in the incoming request. This feature is very usefull when the target server uses virtual hosts.
Comma separated list of HTTP request headers which will not be forwarded from client to server. By default, any other request header will be forwarded. See HTTP headers support for more details.
Comma separated list of HTTP request headers which are discarded by default but have to be forwarded from client to server. See HTTP headers support for more details.
Comma separated list of HTTP request headers which will not be forwarded from server to client . By default, any other response header will be forwarded. See HTTP headers support for more details.
Comma separated list of HTTP response headers which are discarded by default but have to be forwarded from server to client. See HTTP headers support for more details.
The cookieStore to use. Must be a class that implements org.esigate.cookie.CustomCookieStore

Comma separated list of the names of the cookies to ignore. By default, cookies are stored in the session on EsiGate side. You can use the value * to discard all cookies. To use this feature, you must configure org.esigate.http.CookieForwardingFilter as a filter.

Comma separated list of the names of the cookies to forward to the client. By default, cookies are stored in the session on EsiGate side. You can use the value * to forward all cookies. Domain and path are rewritten in order to match the domain and path that are visible from the client. To use this feature, you must configure org.esigate.http.CookieForwardingFilter as a filter.
Fix links to resources, images and pages in the pages retrieved (parse the pages to find or ...)
If "relative" the generated URLs will be relative to the root of the server (ie starting with "/"). If "absolute" generated URLs will be absolute (ie starting with "http://")
The base URL to use while rewriting URLs for links or resources if different from remoteUrlBase
The strategy to use if load balancing (ie remoteUrlBase has been defined as a comma-separated list). Value can be "roundrobin", "iphash" or "stickysession". See clustering for details

The authenticationHandler to use. Must be a class that implements org.esigate.authentication.AuthenticationHandler. Default implementation taken the user authenticated against the application server (request.getRemoteUser()) if any.
The request filter to use. Must be a class that implements org.esigate.filter.Filter
Maximum number of entries in the cache (this parameter is only taken into account by the default implementation)
Maximum size of a cache entry (bytes). If 0, no size limit. This directive can be used to avoid excessive memory usage

Implementation of org.esigate.cache.CacheStorage to use. It can be one of these values:
org.esigate.cache.BasicCacheStorage
org.esigate.cache.EhcacheCacheStorage
org.esigate.cache.MemcachedCacheStorage

Time to live (seconds) of any cached page. If 0, cache expiration will be calculated automatically depending on http response headers. If set to a non-zero value, the value will apply for all GET requests ignoring any Cache-control header!
Heuristic caching enabled (see Caching in HTTP)
Default lifetime of a cache entry if there is absolutely no information about it the http headers.

If non 0, when we receive a request for which an entry is in the cache but this entry is stale, we will send immediately the stale cache entry and try to update it from the server for next time. The value indicates the maximum staleness of the cache entry. This strategy can reduce a lot the load on the target server as there is only 1 refresh request for a cache entry at the same time.
If non 0, when we receive an error from the target server, we will try to use the corresponding cache entry even if it is stale. The value indicates the maximum staleness of the cache entry.
Minimum number of threads processing background revalidations.
Maximum number of threads processing background revalidations. Set this parameter to 0 in order to deactivate background revalidation.
Maximum idle lifetime for a background revalidation thread before it gets reclaimed.
number of retries on a failed cache update.
Maximum number of requests in the revalidation queue.
Xml configuration file for EhCache (loaded via the classloader of the application).
Comma separated list of MemCached servers and ports. Syntax: server1:port1,server2:port2

section.p: You can specify several provider applications prefixing directives with the provider name. Eg for 3 applications, the first one is the default applications, the other ones are called "appli1" and "appli2":

section.name: Variables resolver
section.p: You can define variables in classpath org/esigate/vars.properties

Those variables can be used in page attribute of tags includeBlock,includeTemplate and includeBase or in aggregator. The syntax for using a variable is $(variable_name) and is fixed by the standard ESI.
